TEXT: What is encapsulation in OOP?
RASPUNS1: A process of converting objects into primitive data types.
RASPUNS2: A mechanism that binds data and functions that manipulate the data into a single unit.
RASPUNS3: A way to create multiple instances of a class.
RASPUNS4: The process of arranging data in a sequential order.
RASPUNS_CORECT: A mechanism that binds data and functions that manipulate the data into a single unit.

TEXT: What is the purpose of inheritance in OOP?
RASPUNS1: To hide the internal details of an object and show only the necessary features.
RASPUNS2: To allow a class to have multiple methods with the same name but different parameters.
RASPUNS3: To reuse code and extend the functionality of an existing class.
RASPUNS4: To restrict access to certain class members.
RASPUNS_CORECT: To reuse code and extend the functionality of an existing class.

TEXT: What is polymorphism in OOP?
RASPUNS1: A mechanism to prevent multiple instances of a class.
RASPUNS2: The ability of a class to inherit properties and behaviors from another class.
RASPUNS3: A feature that allows a class to have multiple methods with the same name but different implementations.
RASPUNS4: The process of creating multiple objects from a single class.
RASPUNS_CORECT: A feature that allows a class to have multiple methods with the same name but different implementations.

TEXT: Which OOP principle promotes the idea of separating the interface from the implementation?
RASPUNS_CORECT: Abstraction

TEXT: What is a class in OOP?
RASPUNS1: A blueprint or template for creating objects.
RASPUNS3: A set of predefined data types.
RASPUNS4: A mechanism to restrict access to certain data.
RASPUNS_CORECT: A blueprint or template for creating objects.

TEXT: What does SQL stand for?
RASPUNS_CORECT: Standard Query Language

TEXT: Which SQL clause is used to filter the results of a query based on a specified condition?
RASPUNS_CORECT: WHERE

TEXT: What is the purpose of the SQL JOIN operation?
RASPUNS1: To combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them.
RASPUNS2: To sort the result set in ascending or descending order.
RASPUNS3: To perform mathematical operations on numeric columns.
RASPUNS4: To create a copy of an existing table.
RASPUNS_CORECT: To combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them.

TEXT: Which SQL statement is used to insert new data into a database table?
RASPUNS_CORECT: INSERT

TEXT: What is the purpose of the SQL SELECT statement?
RASPUNS1: To modify existing records in a table.
RASPUNS2: To retrieve data from one or more tables in a database.
RASPUNS3: To delete records from a table.
RASPUNS4: To create a new table in the database.
RASPUNS_CORECT: To retrieve data from one or more tables in a database.

TEXT: What is the primary purpose of an operating system?
RASPUNS2: To manage computer hardware and software resources.
RASPUNS_CORECT: To manage computer hardware and software resources.

TEXT: Which component of the operating system is responsible for managing memory resources?
RASPUNS_CORECT: Memory Manager

TEXT: What is the purpose of a file system in an operating system?
RASPUNS3: To organize and store data on storage devices.
RASPUNS_CORECT: To organize and store data on storage devices.

TEXT: Which scheduling algorithm in operating systems assigns priority levels to tasks and executes the task with the highest priority first?
RASPUNS_CORECT: Priority Scheduling

TEXT: What is the purpose of the device driver in an operating system?
RASPUNS2: To translate high-level programming instructions into machine code.
RASPUNS3: To control communication between the operating system and hardware devices.
RASPUNS_CORECT: To control communication between the operating system and hardware devices.

TEXT: What is the purpose of a data structure in computer science?
RASPUNS2: To manage and organize data for efficient storage and retrieval.
RASPUNS4: To control the flow of program execution.
RASPUNS_CORECT: To manage and organize data for efficient storage and retrieval.

TEXT: Which data structure follows the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle?
RASPUNS_CORECT: Stack

TEXT: What is the time complexity of an algorithm that has a linear execution time?
RASPUNS_CORECT: O(n)

TEXT: Which sorting algorithm has an average-case time complexity of O(n log n)?
RASPUNS_CORECT: Merge Sort

TEXT: What is the purpose of the "hashing" technique in data structures?
RASPUNS1: To rearrange data elements in ascending order.
RASPUNS2: To search for an element in a sorted list.
RASPUNS3: To convert a data element into a fixed-size value, usually for fast retrieval.
RASPUNS4: To create a connected network of nodes.
RASPUNS_CORECT: To convert a data element into a fixed-size value, usually for fast retrieval.

TEXT: What does HTML stand for in the context of web development?
RASPUNS_CORECT: HyperText Markup Language

TEXT: Which programming language is commonly used for client-side scripting in web development?
RASPUNS_CORECT: JavaScript

TEXT: What is the purpose of CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) in web development?
RASPUNS1: To define the structure and content of a web page.
RASPUNS2: To create interactive and dynamic elements on a web page.
RASPUNS3: To style and format the presentation of HTML elements.
RASPUNS4: To handle server-side logic and database operations.
RASPUNS_CORECT: To style and format the presentation of HTML elements.

TEXT: Which protocol is used for secure data transmission over the web?
RASPUNS_CORECT: HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure)

TEXT: What is the purpose of a "responsive design" in web development?
RASPUNS1: To create visually appealing graphics and images.
RASPUNS2: To optimize a website for search engines.
RASPUNS3: To ensure that a website looks and functions well on various devices and screen sizes.
RASPUNS_CORECT: To ensure that a website looks and functions well on various devices and screen sizes.
